intro: Racosperma merrallii, commonly known as the broad-leaved acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has a woody stem with thorny branches, and its leaves are alternate and pinnate. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates. Racosperma merrallii plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects and small animals.
